result.title: Problem in solution: [Edit: Solved now]
result.content:
Problem A. Yet Another Problem with Strings

***** For this question, I have submitted two code with only difference in the line 29, where there is space printed before yes. The problem that I am facing is follows:

for the given test case, when I run my code on hackerrank IDE (yes online IDE), when I use " YES\n" to print I get correct sequence of yes no. But when I try to use "YES\n" (without space), the last NO converts to YES. I have tried emptying the buffer. Any suggestion would be helpful. ALthough image quality is not all that good, different output can be seen. Look at the output in the images

the one with space

the one without space

The whole code 

#include<bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;
int main(){
    int n,q;
    cin>>n>>q;
    int ly=0;
    vector<string> a;
    string b="",s;
    for(int i=0;i<n;i++){
        cin>>s;
        a.push_back(s);
        b=b+s+" ";
    }
    //sort(a.begin(),a.end(),[](string& left,string& right){ return left.length()<right.length();});
    //cout<<a[0];
    for(int qq=0;qq<q;qq++){
        int t;
        cin>>t;
        if(t==1){
            string r;
            cin>>r;
            for(int i=0;i<r.length();i++){
                r[i]=((r[i]-'a'+ly)%26)+'a';
            }
            int i;
            for(i=0;i<n;i++){                
                if(r.find(a[i])!=string::npos)break;
            }            
            if(i<n){ly=qq;cout<<"YES\n"<<flush;}// change is only here ---cout<<" YES\n"---- can be seen from images
            else cout<<"NO\n"<<flush;
        }
        else{
            int i,alpha;            
            cin>>i>>alpha;
            cin.ignore(numeric_limits<streamsize>::max(),'\n');
            int index= (i+ly)%n;
            string ad = (alpha+ly)%26+"a";
            a[index]=a[index]+ad;
        }                
    }
}
